description: Ms. codex. Title from beginning of text (fol. 3a, l. 6-7). Incipit: الحمد لله جاعل العلماء انجمًا للاهتداء زاهرةً واعلامًا للاقتداء طاهرةً ... [3أ] ... اما بعد فهذا كتاب يصغر للحافظ حجمه Explicit: منعنا الشركة او للمسجد من غير ذكر اتفاق يبطلها واجازها تمت Physical description: 9 lines per page. Written in medium large naskh with elements of taʻlīq in black ink with use of red. Cream paper with pulp visible. Ḥāshiyah and short excerpts, mainly fatwas, on the margins and between the lines, apparently by the same hand as the main text. Table of contents on fol. 2a. Several short excerpts on fol. 1a-2a. Lower margin of some leaves worm-eaten. Inscription in Arabic numerals in red pencil on a label pasted on the upper cover: "346". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 1382". Origin: Copy completed by Qāsim ibn SLī in Dhū al-Qaʻdah 866? [July-Aug. 1462] (colophon, fol. 212b).
author: Ibn al-Sāʻātī, Aḥmad ibn ʻAlī, 1254-1294 or 1295
abstract: Compendium on Ḥanafī law, based on the Mukhtaṣar by al-Qudūrī (d. 428/1037) and the Manẓūmah by al-Nasafī (d. 537/1142), completed in 690/1291 (see GAL).
extent: i, 213, i leaves: paper ; 270 x 170 (142 x 100) mm. bound to 270 x 190 mm.
provenance: Seal dated 1303 H. on the pastedown of the envelope flap. Acquired from Abraham Shalom Yahuda, 1942.
